subject: fix(query): improve query builder UX for non-technical users
body:
Six fixes from a UX audit of the query builder:

1. Rename "Run" button to "Search" — plain language for non-technical users
2. Replace date-biased comparison operators ("is before"/"is after") with
   universal labels ("less than"/"greater than") that work for all types
3. Align help modal terminology with actual UI labels — "Has label" not
   "Label", "Connected by" not "Connection", operator names match dropdowns
4. Add mobile touch target overrides for all interactive elements that were
   below the 36-44px guideline (mode toggle, NOT, AND/OR, remove, add buttons)
5. Fix accessibility gaps: focus-visible on remove/action buttons, aria-labels
   on remove buttons, ARIA tab roles on help modal tabs
6. Add "no results" feedback message with plain-language guidance when a
   search returns zero matches
